intro: Corydalis fargesii, commonly known as the Yunnan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, often growing in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
